body_html:
Yeah, Variable(None) is weird. Probably only accidentally supported because of the definition of nn.Parameter's constructor.

RE: undefined vs. zero-sized: I think it's the reverse. We support zero-sized tensors (and variables) in Python. Undefined tensors should never escape to Python.
body_text:
Yeah, Variable(None) is weird. Probably only accidentally supported because of the definition of nn.Parameter's constructor.
RE: undefined vs. zero-sized: I think it's the reverse. We support zero-sized tensors (and variables) in Python. Undefined tensors should never escape to Python.
body:
Yeah, `Variable(None)` is weird. Probably only accidentally supported because of the definition of `nn.Parameter`'s constructor.

RE: undefined vs. zero-sized: I think it's the reverse. We support zero-sized tensors (and variables) in Python. Undefined tensors should never escape to Python.
